scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of letters from Zona Gale Clifford Smythe, Editor of The New York Times Saturday Book Review,discussing reviews and literary matters.

did.unittitle: Letter from Zona Gale, Portage, Wisconsin, to Clifford Smythe 1921 Aug 16

scopecontent.p: Expresses her deep appreciation for Smythe's review of her play in The New York Times Saturday Book Review,"it was not only the charm of what you said - noting the particular things I longed to have noted, finding the bits I wanted to have found. But it was of course that this high word came from you - and also because of this came in a way from The Times, which had best seen what I was driving at."

did.unittitle: Letter from Zona Gale to Clifford Smythe 1922 Nov 15

scopecontent.p: Informs Smythe that she has mailed her little review to him in care of The New York Times Saturday Book Reviewand congratulates him on the new magazine.

did.unittitle: Letter from Zona Gale, Portage, Wisconsin, to Clifford Smythe 1923 Aug 25

scopecontent.p: Writes she will be delighted to review Raw Materialby Dorothy Canfield Fisher (1879-1958), which she likes enormously, in The International Book Review; mentions that Macmillan is bringing out a new edition of her book Birth, "the longest and to me the least unsatisfactory book I have done"; Mr. Pemberton plans to produce two plays of hers, one based on Birth; and asks him to destroy a twelve year photograph of her used with a review.
